result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy Wayne Reignier

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

1:20 PM Defendant Roy Wayne Reignier in court, in custody.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nick Smith appearing specially for the defendant.  Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily. Plea of not guilty to tracking citation.    Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Defendant wrote a letter to the court requesting that the cash bond be reduced to a signature bond.  Statement by Attorney Smith.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court denies the request to amend the bond.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to reschedule 10-18-22 inital appearance and bond reduction by DE
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Roy Wayne Reignier in court, in custody. Defendant is still waiting on a public defender to be appointed. Court continues bond and adjourns the initial appearance until October 18, 2022 at 9:00a.m.-JN
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Cash bond set with cover letter to jail

1:30p.m. Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1,000.00   cash bond with conditions of: reporting to the Taylor County Sheriff's Department for booking procedures, defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, and defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for 10/04/2022 at 9:00a.m. ADR start at 1:36 and end at 1:43-JN
